intro: Phaseolus vulgaris var. pictus, commonly known as the painted bean, is a variant of the common bean characterized by its distinctive variegated foliage. This plant belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is native to the Americas. Its leaves exhibit a striking pattern of green, white, and sometimes yellow, creating a visually appealing appearance. The flowers are typically small and white or pale purple, followed by pods that mature to a dark green or brown hue. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique leaf patterns and adaptability to various growing conditions.
